item.title: [PI]Making Cutscenes
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

if (dialougeAction == 15) {
movePlayer(x, y, h);
getDH().sendDialogues(-1, c.talkingNppc);
getPA().sendFrame177(xCoord, yCoord, Height, CameraSpeed, Angle);
}

Hmm? Make sure when you sendFrame177 that its sending the new coords.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making Cutscenes
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Firstly, for the cutscene to work you will need to make the coords of it in the same location as you’re player.

Anyway

if (dialougeAction == 15) {
getDH().sendDialogues(-1, c.talkingNppc);
getPA().sendFrame177(xCoord, yCoord, Height, CameraSpeed, Angle);
}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making Cutscenes
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

I need to make dialogues and cut scene’s work,
I already have the cutscenes working, but I need my player to see them while it see’s the next dialouge…

Example:

In Dialoguehandler.java

case 15: talk("blah",npcblah,"noob"); c.sendDialouge = 50; break;

In my clickingbuttons.java

case 9157: if dialouge == 15 { c.spincamera("x,y,h,s,a"); break; }

Alright, Yes I know this looks horrible…
But I don’t have my computer with me, And I just really typed this…
And was wondering why it wont show the x and y location i choose, I have to be near that location for it to do the cutscene…
Lol, If you wish go ahead and comment how hideous that code looks…

Read full topic
